# Warfield Complex, Hubner, and T Buildings

Warfield Complex, Hubner, and T Buildings is a national historic district located at Sykesville, Carroll County, Maryland, United States.  It comprises the historic core of the women's facility at Springfield State Hospital, a public mental institution.  It was developed over the period 1898â€“1939.  The complex comprises 16 contributing resources unified by a consistently high level of architectural elaboration in the Georgian and Colonial Revival style.
It was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 2000.
